result.execSummary:
The defendant Devon I Shumpert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Negligent Operation of Motor Vehicle, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Hearing 07-21-2017 at 10:00am.
*07-21-2017/Rest. Hearing - Court ordered Restitution set at zero.
Provide a DNA sample; pay surcharge within 12 months. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept. Court waived cost due to indigency.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devon I Shumpert

records.addlTxt: Per Rest. Hearing on 07-21-2017, set at zero.

Attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell in court, defendant Devon I Shumpert not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm
Case in court for restitution hearing. Statements made by State and Defense. As to reasons placed on the record,  court advises parties advises both parties this court has no jurisdiction to Order Restitution in this case.
Court ordered Restiution set at zero.

Defendant Devon I Shumpert in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Defendant Devon I Shumpert in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements made by the State, Defense counsel and defendant						

AS TO COUNT 1
Court ordered defendant to serve 7 Months the House of corrections concurrent with any other sentence with credit for Zero days time served. 

Provide a DNA sample. DNA surcharge Imposed due within 12 months. Failure to pay will result in civil judgment/tax intercept.  
Court waived cost  due to indigency 
Appellate rights notice given to the defendant.

Documents received and filed.
Notice of right to seek post conviction relief  

Restitution hearing scheduled for July 21, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Order to Produce, recieved and filed.
received and filed.

Defendant Devon I Shumpert in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Defendant Devon I Shumpert in custody.  Randy Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm
Case in court for jury trial, however parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 
Court vacates jury trial. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.

Plea hearing held

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if he is not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.   Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum and Jury Instruction/Elements of the offense, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.   
Court ordered a DNA sample and advised defendant of applicable surcharge.

AS TO COUNT 2 
Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered COUNT 2 DISMISSED and read in for purposes for sentencing.


Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 31  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 13, 2017 at 08:30 am.
